news.headline: Apple's AI shakeup: They might not be 'moving the needle' on AI
news.summary: Apple (AAPL) is shaking up its AI executives, according to a Bloomberg report, as the tech giant prioritizes its artificial intelligence offerings. The company has delayed the launch of its AI-enhanced Siri digital assistant until 2026. TechRadar Editor-At-Large Lance Ulanoff sits down with Josh Lip

news.headline: Apple, in effort to turn around Siri, shakes up executive ranks, Bloomberg says
news.summary: Apple (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook lost faith in AI head John Giannandrea to execute on product development and drafted in Vision Pro creator Mike Rockwell to oversee Siri, Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman reports. news.headline: Report: Apple Reassigns Siri Development to Vision Pro Executive as AI Strategy Evolves
news.summary: Siri is no longer under AI chief John Giannandrea, amid delays in improvements until 2026.
